Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: block confirmed import is to use `getimports` RPC to scan for the import txid, and check the export txid.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: A script should be able to verify everything after the fact no problem... may take a while to run... but it will work.

Author: CrisF#3405

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
ok so final version I think is this:
`{"src_chain":"CFEK", :src_sum":10, "import_txid": <txid>, "timeofexport":1546341430, "dest_chain":"CFEKED", "dest_sum":10, "export_txid": <txid>, "timeofimport":1546341430,}` 
timeofexport must be confirmed export tx (not went created, so we can check it on chain)
timeofimport must be confirmed on target so we can check it on chain
getrawtransaction can be used to verify the submitted data is correct
getimports can be looped over every chain in the cluster to gather global stats after the fact.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Then is should be easy to see, if the total amounts excceed each user added together, (no coins were lost or created)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think maybe minimum 4 chains in the cluster + 2 chains for oracles. This can be discussed by everyone, remember right now we need a full KMD node on each VPS doing migrates. So launchinfg 300 google clouds isnt an option 😄

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: OK.  So that's the stats and proof. There's another big thing.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think thats all we need yes

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: A central place for KMD signing would be great, but probably out of reach at this stage.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and I think in a stress test, it could be overwhelmed.

Content:
We need to know of failures.
And get a log for debugging.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: log fails locally

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You will know if they failed, because you have txid of export but no import tx

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: hmmm

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: maybe then the stats need to be 2 seperate JSONs

Content: Yeah.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
`{"src_chain":"CFEK", :src_sum":10, "export_txid": <txid>, "timeofexport":1546341430, "hex": <export tx full hex>, "payouts":<payouts hash> }  
{"dest_chain":"CFEKED", "dest_sum":10, "import_txid": <txid>, "timeofimport":1546341430}`

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: That would be useful for future tests.  2 separate modules.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes thats much better.... confirm your export log it to oracle

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: then when import is confirmed log it

Content: If the import fails, the script should already be logging it... so push to file,. then send into oracle.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Not that you need to

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: because you know things failed if exports > imports

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Use oracle data to total up all exports... then teh getimports RPC for total imported across all chains... if these are not the same... something went wrong...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: hmm what happens though, if its a VPS crash or something... script should save the export tx

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @Bar_F1sh_Rel In v2 I'm not using threading, just using lists (hexes or txids on each step) in step by step flow. Not hard to output any transactions list to file if needed. Minimising prints much in script itself may make script hard to debug if something go wrong -  I think it's better to just forward stdout on execution to file if needed to make logs

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: So there is let's say `payouts_list` or `signed_hexes_list` and you can save to file/files all that you need

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Will publish this one asap
